skillTree.name: Barded Warhorse
skillTree.description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

skillTree.name: Loyalty to the Motherland
skillTree.description: "My blood! The blood of my father! The blood of my country! To them I owe loyalty! To them I owe obedience!"

skillTree.name: Lightning Fast
skillTree.description: Without a shield to protect her, it is vital that Ulrika remains swift of heel, so she can move, twist and dodge as the arrows rain down.

skillTree.name: Ulgu Exponent
skillTree.description: A useful benefit of the Blood Kiss is the ability to command the Lore of Shadow, which gives Ulrika greater protection against proponents of the other Winds of Magic.

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.name: Blight of the Skaven
skillTree.description: Those filthy, craven ratmen hold no fear for Ulrika. In fact, she is a plague on their kind, wiping their stain from the land at every given opportunity.

effects.description:
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%
	(accompanying Lord)

skillTree.name: Dragonslayer
skillTree.description: Alongside Gotrek, the fabled Dwarf Slayer, and Felix, his mannish chronicler, Ulrika put down the Dragon Skjalandir after first blinding the behemoth and rendering it incapable.

effects.description: "Heavy Arrow" ammunition (bonus vs large and AP damage)

skillTree.name: Beastslayer
skillTree.description: What could and would surely kill another, Ulrika has survived, albeit with a little help from a magic-using friendâ€¦

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: -50%
	(Hero's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from Chaos attrition
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.name: Vampireslayer
skillTree.description: Seeing her father slain by the Vampire Krieger gave Ulrika the strength, both physical and of will, to break free of her bonds, along with a passionate hatred.

skillTree.name: Bloodborn
skillTree.description: Such a transformation fills the foe with terror while enabling Ulrika and her host to heal more easily.

effects.description:
Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.name: Bloodforged
skillTree.description: Now she is fully reborn in blasphemy and blood, Ulrika can now control her hunger, increasing her power whilst draining that of her enemies.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -6
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.name: Confident All-Rounder
skillTree.description: Ulrika's teen years were spent honing her duelling skills, which has left her with attack and defence capabilities of equal parity.

skillTree.name: Merciless Attacker
skillTree.description: Always an advocate of getting stuck in, woe betide any who threaten or harm those dear to Ulrika Magdova.

skillTree.name: Prudent Defender
skillTree.description: As much as the best form of defence is offence, it remains essential to know how to defend oneself, for some adversaries may be stronger or faster than they first appear to be.

skillTree.name: Insurance Policy
skillTree.description: Even the most skilled professional soldier recognises the advantages of wearing a well-forged plate or suit of mail.

skillTree.name: Accomplished Cavalrywoman
skillTree.description: A highly-skilled horsewoman, Ulrika was trained in the equestrian arts from a very young age, and taught to fight just as effectively from the saddle as out of it.

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: No-Qualms Killer
skillTree.description: In the real world, duelling is not simply a matter of striking and parrying. You must not just score a hit, you must kill your opponent, and do so before they kill you!

skillTree.name: Staying Power
skillTree.description: If you dish it out, it's literally vital that you can also take a degree of punishment before death's icy hand reaches out to claim your life.

skillTree.name: Uncanny Range
skillTree.description: Among Ulrika's many impressive martial abilities is her command of her compound bow, with which she demonstrates the skill to kill from a considerable distance away.

skillTree.name: All A-Quiver
skillTree.description: Always take an extra quiver or two on campaign, because you never know when you're going to need them.

skillTree.name: Deadly Onslaught
skillTree.description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

skillTree.name: Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma
skillTree.description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Smoke & Mirrors
skillTree.description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.

skillTree.name: The Enfeebling Foe
skillTree.description: When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.name: The Withering
skillTree.description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.name: The Penumbral Pendulum
skillTree.description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Pit of Shades
skillTree.description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Okkam's Mindrazor
skillTree.description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Increase Mobility
skillTree.description: Whether it be training harder, travelling lighter, eating less or sleeping better, there's always a way to draw more from the day.

effects.description: Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 5%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 10%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.name: Spread Control
skillTree.description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 1
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.name: Damage Walls
skillTree.description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.name: Wound
skillTree.description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.name: Assault Units
skillTree.description: Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.name: Specialist
skillTree.description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

backgroundSkills.name: Boyar Lineage
backgroundSkills.description: "I am no servant! I am a boyar's daughter. I have commanded a hundred Kossars! I can trace my lineage back one thousand years!"

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for Empire and Kislev melee infantry
	(Hero's army)

Leadership: +4 for Empire and Kislev melee infantry
	(Hero's army)
